dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry me! She shouts down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief!  Chief!  Could you come up here, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to marry us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm jumping into a volcano!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So marry me and then jump into the volcano. The Chief arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you marry us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get married!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem? You afraid of the commitment?  You'll have to love me and honor me for about thirty seconds!  You can't handle that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Chief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Marry us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to marry her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to marry him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going now. The Chief leaves.  The volcano has been ROARING LOUDER and LOUDER.  Joe stares into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to listen Patricia, because these are my last words.  I gotta be brave. I gotta jump in. He braces to jump.  She lifts her hands.  She hesitates. Courage floods her soul.  She completes the gesture for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm jumping in with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you're not'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whither thou goest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll knock you out!  I'll throw you down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take away my freedom of choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the raft.  You gave me the water.  No one's ever put my life ahead of theirs.  So I love YOU and I'm jumping into this volcano with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you that the first time I saw you, I felt like I'd seen you before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.  They kiss.  There's a big EXPLOSION.  The ground shakes.  They lose their balance and grab each other.  There's a second EXPLOSION.  He loses his balance.  She catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it! They look at each other.  They jump in. A SLOW-MO stylized leap.  Right after they jump in, the platform slides into the volcano.

dialogues.speaker: WHOLE ISLAND
dialogues.text: Which looks like a face.  The face grimaces.  We hear a GASTRONOMIC GROAN.  Then the volcano spits out Joe and Patricia who are holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: JOE AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: rocketing Against a background of fire and EXPLOSIONS, come rocketing RIGHT AT us and BY the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF AND HIS PEOPLE
dialogues.text: They watch Joe and Patricia, out of view, go by overhead. The Waponis scream and take off down the hill.  The Tobi smiles and stays.  He speaks to the Woo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You did not want them. (to the retreating natives)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't go to that no good island! (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me, this is the end. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: JOE AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: leaving a trail of smoke, land in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just spit us back out again. Joe, we're rejects!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I did it.  I did it.  I did my job.  I jumped into the volcano.  We jumped into the volcano.

dialogues.speaker: STRETCH OF BEACH WITH BOATS
dialogues.text: The Waponis grab their ducks under their arms, grab their boats and launch themselves.

dialogues.speaker: JOE AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: in the water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see the Waponis fleeing the exploding island, heading for the lousy island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOLCANO EXPLODING completely.  The whole island is on fire and breaking apart.

dialogues.speaker: JOE AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: watch while paddling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The island is sinking.  The Waponis are fleeing. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 4/14/89

dialogues.speaker: JOE. AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: looking at this amazing sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Waponis were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 4/14/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said if there wasn't a sacrifice, their island would sink.  And it did. Joe and Patricia exchange looks.  Then Patricia looks past Joe, seeing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, look!  Look! Joe looks where she's looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yacht just like the one they were on.  This yacht has friendly eye of another color.

dialogues.speaker: JOE AND PATRICIA
dialogues.text: in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's The Tweedle Dum! (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahoy!  Ahoy! (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! They start to swim. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking up Joe and Patricia.  Patricia's crew is on board, that is Dagmar and the boat boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my crew!  They're alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful!  That's amazing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were very lucky. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 4/14/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graynamore is watching the island sink through a telescope.  Meanwhile, two boat boys wrap Patricia and Joe in blankets.  Graynamore, oddly calm and detached, given the circumstances, looks away from the eyepiece of the telescope.  He says to no one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes my dream of beating the shit out of the competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Graynamore ignores her.  During this scene the island is slowly sinking in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kept your bargain, Mr. Banks. To the letter.  The miracle of course is that you kept the bargain and you're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?  My number's about up one way or the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's a trifle uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead, young lady.  I thought you drowned. Both of you for that matter. I just got here to see what kind of alternate deal I could cut with the Chief.  But the Chief, I'm afraid, is history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't show any sign of being glad I'm alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm glad.  I'm just disappointed about losing these mineral rights.  It meant a lot to me.  It was a real opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so... full of holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Graynamore looks at her, a little irritated and puzzled. But then his attention shifts to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small boat, Mr. Banks. Too small to keep a big secret all the way back to L.A.  Come out, Kenneth! Kenneth emerges from the shadows where he's been skulking.  It's Dr. Ellison; the doctor who told Joe he was going to die.  He's got a drink and he looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ellison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or words to that effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Kenneth Hindmick. Business Affairs.  He works for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Need your taxes done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth Hindmick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any terrible job done? I'm your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Dr. Ellison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth Hindmick.  I'm not a bad guy, really.  I just have an unfortunate tendency to do what I'm told. Joe nods numbly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Kenneth Hindmick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he made believe he was a Dr. Ellison. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he told Joe here that he had something called a brain cloud, and that he was going to die. So that Joe here would agree to jump in the volcano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  That's dastardly.  You're both dastards. Joe, still focused on Hindmick, pushes her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a brain cloud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't have anything. You're just a hypochondriac. Sorry.  Or, looking on the bright side, congratulations! Joe takes a step for Kenneth. Kenneth takes out a gun and points it shakily at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm gonna beat you up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!  Don't make me kill you when there's nothing wrong with you!  I feel bad enough already.  I told you he'd be mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll just take turns watching him till we get back to L.A. Nobody'll believe his story anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.  I'll back him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Patricia, when we get back, I'm going to give this boat to you, and you can sail off into the distance with it and be done with us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to Kenneth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll take turns watching the two of them till we get back to L.A., and then we'll turn them both loose, and I'll keep the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've forgotten one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I have?  Nothing comes readily to mind. Joe is still facing Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked into the volcano, Mr. Graynamore.  You know what I mean?  After that, the hole in the front of a gun doesn't scare me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take the gun away from you, Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I won't shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  That's your part.  I can't make you shoot me and I can't stop you.  I can only do my part.  I'm going to take the gun away from you. Joe, after slowly approaching, swiftly takes the gun away from Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd had the gun, you'd be dead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never know.  Patricia, tell Dad the happy news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got married.  The Chief married us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was wondering where you thought we should go on, you know, a honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 4/14/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we might like to go on a sailing trip.  How's that sound? Graynamore doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that sounds great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this thing have like a rubber raft or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has a dinghy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's break it out.  I think your father's tired of this ostentatious life style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Graynamore and company are just finished getting into a dinghy.  Joe and Patricia stand on the deck, Joe still pointing the gun.  Patricia's crew stands by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if there's a storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll pay for this.  I'll see to that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I think, Mr. Graynamore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that you don't scare me at all.  Maybe you can do some stuff to me - if you make it back home. If I come back. And maybe you can't.  It remains to be seen.  But what I think, and I say this to you from the bottom of my heart, sir.  I don't fear you at all. I don't fear any man.  Because every day is a gift, and I'm just glad as hell it looks like I may have a few. And beyond that, to be scared or glad of anything beyond that, why a man's just got to be a fool! Joe laughs a laugh, wild and free, a laugh unweighted by fear, a laugh of pure joy.  Patricia goes below.  Only here does the island finally go under completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts up.  And pulls away from the dinghy.  Joe is still laughing and waving, one hand on the wheel. Patricia comes up from below.  He puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graynamore is thoughtful.  He starts to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that boy!  Good for her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for her?  What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a tight spot.  Maybe I have gotten a little greedy. (produces a paddle and hands it to Kenneth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start paddling while I re- assess my values. (as Kenneth doesn't start)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start paddling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lights a pipe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Fair enough.  We'll both paddle.  'And all I ask is a tall ship and a star to steer her by!' Com'on, let's put our backs into it. (stops rowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I have a good feeling about this.  Maybe we're going to become friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that.  You're just too overbearing. Graynamore begins to sing "Someone's in the Kitchen with Dinah" as they paddle out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinghy has gone.  The boat is passing over the spot where the island went down.  A lot of bubbles and steam are still coming up.  A few empty cans of Jump come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the end of Waponi Woo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the things of man! I gotta get away from the things of man for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: BUBBLING SURFACE
dialogues.text: His trunks start rising to the surface, one after the other.  Until three trunks are bobbing on the surface. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 6/2/89                    A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you one thing. Wherever we're goin'.  We're taking this luggage.  Help me fish it out.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBLING TO THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The Chief comes up on the last trunk.  He is holding his Tiki teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphantly gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  Look, Joe Banks, I still have my soul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.  Me, too. JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO - Rev. 5/16/89

dialogues.speaker: 209C BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Joe and Patricia smile at each other and help the Chief up onto the boat.  We STAY where we are, LOOKING AT the horizon OVER the railing of the boat. MUSIC. The big, dramatic pas de deux music from the NUTCRACKER starts to play.  A moon, with its volcanic aspect emphasized, a moon that's simply too big to be real, starts to rise from the sea.  It rises into and up OUT OF the FRAME while: THE CREDITS ROLL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon hangs in the sky off to the right of the boat. We see, FROM a distance, Joe and Patricia just getting the last trunk on deck. Then Patricia goes below. The ENGINE STARTS up. The boat turns and heads straight for the moon. MUSIC. DUSTY SPRINGFIELD, singing "You Don't Have To Say You Love Me" begins to play. We watch them grow fainter and fainter, a smaller and smaller speck in the eye of the Man in the Moon.  UP CLOSE to us, the DOLPHIN sticks his head out of the water again, makes his NOISE once more, and disappears forever beneath the gentle waves.  One of the craters on the craterous moon shakes and erupts, puffing out a bunch of white smoke which forms the words: "The End."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
